Lion Blood Clothing was founded by Nate Burleson (of the Detroit Lions) and Robert Montalvo.

name: Detroit Tigers "Bless you Boys"
description: Made by Homage "Bless You Boys" was a catchphrase coined by Detroit sportscaster Al Ackerman, after the Tigers started off the 1984 season 35-5. Sparky Anderson, the Manager of the Detroit Tigers, wrote a book which was titled, "Bless You Boys: Diary of the Detroit Tigers' 1984 season". This chronicled the first 151 games of the 1984 season and eventual World Series Championship. Made from a higher quality fabric, this shirt is soft, lightweight, and super comfortable!
